title: Velocity vs. time graphs for dropped and thrown

content.question: Object A is released from rest at height h. At the same instant, object B is thrown downward from the same location. Which of the following graphs of speed of v as a function of time t is correct for the two objects?

choices.label: Both lines start at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis. Line B is above A and is steeper than A.
The two lines are parallel to each other with B above A. Line B starts about one-fourth of the way up from the horizontal axis. Line A starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis.
Line B starts about one-fourth of the way up from the horizontal axis. Line A starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis. Line B is above A and is steeper than A.
Line B starts above one-fourth of the way up from the horizontal axis. Line A starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis. Line B is above A, and line A is steeper than B.

The two lines are parallel to each other with Line A above B. Line A starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis. Line B starts about one-fourth of the way along the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The two lines are parallel to each other with B above A. Line B starts about one-fourth of the way up from the horizontal axis. Line A starts at the intersection of the horizontal and vertical axis.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
